title: First Lady Michelle Obama Announces New Public Awareness Campaign as part of Her Reach Higher Initiative | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the First Lady


For Immediate Release
October 15, 2015

 



First Lady Michelle Obama Announces New Public Awareness Campaign as part of Her Reach Higher Initiative





FIRST LADY MICHELLE OBAMA ANNOUNCES 

NEW PUBLIC AWARENESS CAMPAIGN AS PART OF HER REACH HIGHER INITIATIVE

Monday, October 19

Washington, DC * 11:00AM ET – The First Lady will deliver remarks in the East Room to announce a new public awareness campaign to reach students as part of her Reach Higher initiative. 

Reach Higher aims to encourage every student in America to take charge of their future by completing their education past high school, whether at a professional training program, a community college, or a four-year college or university.

For more information, please join our upcoming, embargoed on-the-record press call on Friday, October 16th at 2:30pm. 

Wednesday, October 21

Akron, OH * 2:30PM ET – As part of her Reach Higher efforts, the First Lady will join LeBron James for a special event in Akron with thousands of students and parents from the LeBron James Family Foundation’s Wheels for Education and Akron I PROMISE Network programs. The event will highlight the importance of post-secondary education and take place at the University of Akron.

Earlier this year, the LeBron James Family Foundation and the University of Akron announced a commitment to financially cover a college education for thousands of the program’s current and future qualified students. In order to earn the scholarships, the students must graduate from a high school within the Akron Public School district and achieve standard testing, attendance, community service, and other academic standards as agreed to by the University and the LeBron James Family Foundation.
